name: classic baby hats
notes:
materials
to make all three hats, you’ll need…

2 skeins of purl soho’s [santolina][1], 70% organically grown cotton, 20% bamboo, and 10% hemp. each skein is 328 yards/ 100 grams.
- color a: 1 (1) skein; approximately 200 (220) yards required. we used peach lily.
- color b: 1 (1) skein; approximately 171 (188) yards required. we used well water.

you will also need...
- a set of us 2 or 2.5 (3mm) [double pointed needles][2] or us 2 or 2.5, 32-inch [circular knitting needles][3] for magic loop
- a [stitch marker][4]
- optional: a pom pom maker. we used [purl soho’s pom pom maker set][5] in small + large to make a 1-inch pom pom for the roll brim hat.

note: one hat in one color without a pom pom requires approximately 124 (136) yards.

gauge
32 stitches and 40 rounds = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

sizes
newborn (baby)

- finished circumference: 13½ (15) inches
- finished height: approximately 6½ (7) inches


designed by purl soho designer, [whitney van nes][6].


  [1]: https://www.purlsoho.com/santolina.html
  [2]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--double_pointed_needles.html
  [3]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--circular_needles.html
  [4]: https://www.purlsoho.com/tools-and-notions/collection_filter--stitch_markers.html
  [5]: https://www.purlsoho.com/pom-pom-maker-set.html
